title: ASEP via Mallows coloring
abstract:
In this paper we study the asymptotic behavior of the Asymmetric Simple
Exclusion Process (=ASEP) with finitely many particles. It turns out that a
certain randomized initial condition is the most amenable to such an analysis.
Our main result is the behavior of such an ASEP in the KPZ limit regime. A key
technical tool introduced in the paper -- the coloring of ASEP particles with
the use of random Mallows permutations -- may be of independent interest.
